background.name: Amnesiac
entries: Some portion of your past has been swallowed by nothingness. Flashes of déjà vu tease you, but slip away as ungraspable as the mists of Druskenvald.

items: {@b Skills.} Choose two (you determine these during play using Scattered Memories).
{@b Equipment.} Choose A or B: (A) Book (personal notes), Ink, Ink Pen, Traveler’s Clothes, 11 gp; or (B) 50 gp.

entries.name: Scattered Memories
entries: You don’t choose your skill proficiencies, tool proficiency, or the two languages that are part of your origin when you select this background. Instead, during play you can recall one of these at any time (even as you make a roll that relies on it). After choosing one, you can’t choose another until you gain a level. The GM might allow an early recall if something meaningfully reminds you of your past.

entries.name: Building an Amnesiac
entries: Consider how you lost your memory—injury, illness, toxin, curse, or something more sinister. You might even leave the cause to be discovered in play.

rows: Recurring dreams of someone you might recognize on your adventures.
You absent-mindedly doodle the same symbol over and over.
A friend travels Druskenvald with a caravan searching for hints of your past.
A rhyme or song you’ve never heard comes to mind when your thoughts wander.
Rainbow colors—like on a soap bubble or oil slick—fill you with unexplained terror.
You recollect fragments of traveling to a remote place in the mountains.
Half of a tarnished silver ring with a partial inscription in an unknown language.
A music box that plays a sad tune you recognize but can’t identify.
A short note addressed to you and signed with a name you don’t recognize.
A thin silk scarf with a fading scent that stirs familiarity.
A toy horse with unfamiliar initials inked on it.
A locket whose portrait is burnt and unrecognizable.

background.name: Crimson Aspirant
entries: You have delved into the forces that animate all life and the power of blood to sustain and transmit vital essence.

items: {@b Equipment.} Choose A or B: (A) Herbalism Kit, Dagger, Fine Clothes, Healer’s Kit, 3 Vials, 10 gp; or (B) 50 gp.

entries.name: Building a Crimson Aspirant
entries: Scholars, healers, and the physically inclined alike may be drawn to the teachings of blood—to tap increased vital energies or overcome frailty.

rows: When you bleed, you hear whispers from your fallen blood.
Your mentor’s remote monastery expelled you in a panic.
A plague carried in the blood defies cures; you seek its origin.
The mentor who inducted you into blood’s secrets vanished suddenly.
Your studies reveal deaths by blood‑drinking monsters.
A loved one died; your studies hint at a way to bring them back.
A glass pendant with a single drop of blood suspended within.
A long scroll with an anatomical study of vital energies.
A handkerchief with a pressed blood drop at the center.
A polished bloodstone for balancing vital energy.
A vial of blood that never coagulates or dries.
A small box of ashes said to be from a martyr falsely accused of vampirism.

background.name: Crossroads Gambler
entries: You made your bones on games of chance—until you wagered far more than coin against fiends, fey, or the fabled Mister Crossroads.

items: {@b Tools.} One kind of Gaming Set.
{@b Equipment.} Choose A or B: (A) Gaming Set (same as above), Caltrops, Fine Clothes, Fine Wine (bottle), 23 gp; or (B) 50 gp.

entries.name: Building a Crossroads Gambler
entries: Rogues, Bards, desperate conjurers, and the bold all find themselves playing for impossible stakes—and trying to outrun the bill.

rows: A ‘friend’ tricked you into making your bargain.
If too long passes without a wager, your luck turns sour.
You only feel alive in the midst of a contest.
You lost your bet and now flee what’s coming to collect.
Someone close to you lost a wager; you made your deal to find them.
You’re tired of gambling—you want a way out.
A lucky coin made of a strange material (green steel, bone, etc.).
A battered, blood‑stained six of hearts playing card.
A torn journal page of a long‑missing gambler describing an unnamed being.
The preserved foot of a rabbit, owl, or weasel.
A die that oddly seems to have too many 2s.
A silver‑plated ivory chess rook.

background.name: Cultist
entries: You were inducted into a secret society that venerates or pursues power from an otherworldly source.

items: {@b Skills.} Arcana, plus one of your choice (the Cultist Affinity table offers recommendations).
{@b Languages.} One of your choice (see the Affinity table).
{@b Equipment.} Choose A or B: (A) Calligrapher’s Supplies, Costume (cult garb), Holy Symbol (amulet with cult insignia), Traveler’s Clothes, 10 gp; or (B) 50 gp.

entries.name: Building a Cultist
entries: Were you manipulated by a surrogate family, still loyal for infiltration, or fleeing after a crisis of faith?

rows: You learned your cult manipulated you throughout your life.
A cultist betrayed and slew your leader and mentor.
Your cult’s activities aroused local ire and superstition.
You followed a loved one into joining the cult, trying to learn what happened to them.
Someone forced you to see your cult in a different light.
You joined the cult to save yourself from an incurable illness or certain doom.
A sealed scroll of esoteric knowledge.
A steel ball bearing etched over its entire surface with sacred text.
A crystal that feels strange to the touch.
A ritual knife stained with blood, sap, or oils.
A set of copper tattoo needles.
An embroidered cloth half mask.

background.name: Druskenvald Dweller
entries: You hail from one of the thirteen baneful provinces of Druskenvald, whose cultures and skills shaped you.

items: {@b Feat.} {@feat Choose one Origin feat (from this book or core rules)|TCM}.
{@b Skills.} Survival, plus one of your choice (see Province Affinities).
{@b Tools.} One of your choice (see Province Affinities).
{@b Equipment.} Choose A or B: (A) An appropriate artisan’s tools (matching your chosen tool), Map (Druskenvald’s provinces), Traveler’s Clothes, 10 gp; or (B) 50 gp.

Left on a church doorstep as an infant; only a torn cloak hints at your origin.
You fled your home province after being accused of a crime.
Stories of other provinces spurred you to travel Druskenvald.
A trade caravan harmed someone dear to you or stole something precious.
You made a desperate pact with an ashborn and seek to nullify it.
A vicious bogborn bounty hunter trails you.
A brass needle with a dangling bit of broken thread.
A dull, rusty sickle with a bone handle.
A star chart etched onto a crystal plate.
A wicker doll with bloodstained bead eyes.
A length of chain that sometimes rattles unattended.
A mummified hand preserved in bog peat.

background.name: Experiment
entries: You were forever altered by a blasphemous fusion of science, alchemy, and magic—perhaps to mend a malady or test the limits of your biology.

items: {@b Equipment.} Choose A or B: (A) Alchemist’s Supplies, Manacles, Perfume (to cover chemical smell), Traveler’s Clothes (with hooded cloak), 5 gp; or (B) 50 gp.

entries.name: Building an Experiment
entries: Were you kidnapped and altered against your will, or did you volunteer? Whatever the reason, the process left visible and invisible scars.

rows: A particular song stirs sadness and overwhelming anger, reminding you of the procedure.
Part of your body is clearly grafted from someone else—and they might want it back.
Another person was changed alongside you and fled before you could.
Recurring nightmares of the procedure show glimpses of unknown faces.
Your difference invites curiosity and attention—more disturbing than disdain.
A peculiar symbol is branded on or near your alteration.
A syringe with faintly glowing purple residue.
A wrench that fits simple machinery built into your body.
Chemical‑stained parchments of incomprehensible notes and schematics.
A spool of silver thread matching stitches in your altered body part.
A metal hip flask scratched with strange runes.
A smooth stone that soothes you when held tightly.

background.name: Ghostlight Passenger
entries: You once rode the deathly train known as the Ghostlight Express and formed a lasting connection with its conductor and travelers.

items: {@b Equipment.} Choose A or B: (A) Smith’s Tools, Bullseye Lantern, Fine Clothes, Oil (3 flasks), 5 gp; or (B) 50 gp.

rows: Sometimes, when you dream, you find yourself back on the Ghostlight Express.
Your first journey to the lands of the dead hints you can find a once‑lost loved one.
A specific spirit returns to speak to (and through) you repeatedly.
Strangers sometimes know you from your visits on the Ghostlight Express—then forget.
You see people in your travels who you recognize from the train.
Someone greeted you with knowledge of your first journey, but you don’t remember them.
A slate board smeared with erased chalk; words sometimes appear.
A lump of coal that never burns away and gives off wispy smoke.
A torn ticket stub that is slightly translucent.
A dented conductor’s whistle that only the dead can hear.
A pocket watch that runs backwards.
A battered train conductor’s hat.

background.name: Night Stalker
entries: Once prey to a monster, now you are the hunter—deadlier and hungrier than what stalked you.

items: {@b Skills.} Stealth, plus one of Arcana, History, Religion, or Nature.
{@b Equipment.} Choose A or B: (A) Leatherworker’s Tools, Book (one creature type), Hooded Lantern, Hunting Trap, Oil (3 flasks), Traveler’s Clothes, 8 gp; or (B) 50 gp.

rows: You hunt the creature that slew your loved ones.
You’re losing your stomach for the hunt.
Research reveals some of your initial assumptions were wrong.
You failed to stand up to a creature and saved yourself instead of someone else.
They terrify you to your soul; you lash out to deny your fear.
Your fervent hunt hides a desire to become more than mortal.
A necklace of yellowed fangs.
Letters showing a personality eroding into incoherence and raving.
A knife made from a massive creature’s claw.
A casting of a monstrous footprint.
A hide or pelt from a vicious beast.
A glass eye that normal animals shy away from.

background.name: Reflected Wanderer
entries: Part of you separated from your being and wanders the world as a mirage identical to you, taking your reflection and shadow with it.

items: {@b Equipment.} Choose A or B: (A) Disguise Kit, Mirror, Traveler’s Clothes, 16 gp; or (B) 50 gp.

rows: A close, long‑term relationship soured as if you wronged the other person.
Your other self leaves messages—sometimes fond, other times resentful.
Animals become skittish and restless around you.
You’re wanted for crimes you never committed; eyewitnesses named you.
An enemy starts treating you with respect and kindness.
Mirrors sometimes crack when you touch them.
A shattered hand mirror.
An invitation to a powerful person’s home whom you’ve never met.
A locket with your silhouette painted on both sides, facing each other.
A short, derisive letter from yourself you don’t remember writing.
A brooch delivered to you that you didn’t purchase.
A piece of chalk that writes in a different color than it appears.

background.name: Rest Warden
entries: You tend the eternal rest and disposition of the deceased—gravedigger, mortician, embalmer—standing between Undead depredations and those you watch over.

items: {@b Equipment.} Choose A or B: (A) Mason’s Tools, Hooded Lantern, Oil (3 flasks), Shovel, Soap, Traveler’s Clothes (with thick gloves and dark hood), 10 gp; or (B) 50 gp.

rows: A strange figure commissioned a headstone for someone very much alive.
In desperation, you once accepted a bribe to look the other way during a grave robbery.
You learned from Yorgrim, gravedigger and caretaker of Maidenmist Cemetery.
Someone violated graves under your watch and stole the corpses.
You comforted a child at their parent’s funeral and now protect them.
A loved one rose as Undead; you vowed to bring them to final rest.
A prayer slip and seal covered in verses to protect the departed.
A charcoal rubbing of a gravestone epitaph.
A coffin nail that always ends up bent.
A dried flower from one of the first graves you tended.
A length of rusty iron chain and padlock.
A sealed bottle containing a final breath.

background.name: Reveler
entries: You traveled with the Lord of Fools’ unsettling revelry, learning its masks, mirth, and the madness beneath.

items: {@b Languages.} One of your choice (Abyssal recommended).
{@b Tools.} One kind of Musical Instrument.

{@b Equipment.} Choose A or B: (A) Musical Instrument (same as above), Ball Bearings, Costume (jovial character with a laughing mask), Hunting Trap, Manacles, 3 Torches (for juggling), Traveler’s Clothes, 10 gp; or (B) 50 gp.

rows: Posters depicting your reveler guise appear in towns after the revel leaves.
You learned that some who vanish to ‘join’ the revel are sacrificed; you fled.
More people than usual have gone missing after recent revels.
Crows, owls, and other birds seem to cackle and laugh in your presence.
Another reveler may hide a sinister motive behind their jester’s guise.
You left after glimpsing the wickedness beneath the Lord of Fools’ jovial veneer.
A small wind‑up bell concealed in the palm with a hidden button.
A dented metal spray bottle.
A string of colorful handkerchiefs tied together.
A tarnished silver bell that sometimes refuses to jingle.
Boots or slippers that squeak comically with each step.
A short scepter or baton with a horn on the cap.

background.name: Scholar of the Forbidden
entries: You delved into brittle pages and weathered tablets carved with blasphemy, seizing forbidden knowledge and cursed power.

items: {@b Languages.} One of your choice (Deep Speech recommended).
{@b Equipment.} Choose A or B: (A) Calligrapher’s Supplies, Book (a topic of arcana), Ink, Ink Pen, Lamp, Oil (3 flasks), Paper (10 sheets), 2 gp; or (B) 50 gp.

entries.name: Scholar of the Forbidden Story Threads

rows: A wealthy patron wants what you found and paid you handsomely to research it.
Speaking the first secret word made you pass out; your lips later were cracked and blackened.
Something has followed you since you uncovered illicit secrets, drawing closer.
Your shadow converses with you when you’re alone.
The reflections of your eyes are black voids that no one else seems to notice.
Inquisitors or witch hunters hound you to silence you and your discoveries.
A broken fragment of a stone tablet carved with writhing symbols.
A desiccated bit of tentacle.
A small soapstone idol that always ends up on your person.
A book bound in humanoid skin with blank pages that absorb pigment.
An alien eyeball floating in preservative fluid.
An antique amulet with indecipherable symbols that whisper at the edge of consciousness.

background.name: Wicker Weaver
entries: You know ancient rites kept alive by secretive druids and hedge practitioners—remedies and hexes woven into wicker charms.

items: {@b Equipment.} Choose A or B: (A) Quarterstaff, Weaver’s Tools, Basket (with dry reeds), Book (druidic lore), Iron Pot, Traveler’s Clothes, 19 gp; or (B) 50 gp.

rows: A charm you created ensured a healthy birth; the family sends heartfelt gifts.
Your mentor has become withdrawn and uncharacteristically agitated.
An order of druids, the Circle of Wicker, taught you their ways—for reasons unknown.
Someone offered a shocking sum to twist a charm for them; you’re tempted and unsettled.
You traded a hexed charm for a child’s toy that now binds misfortune to its owner.
You wove a hex into a charm to punish a criminal; they still nurse the grudge.
A crescent woven from wicker and laced with silver wire.
A glass bauble—your first payment for hedge wisdom.
A tiny figure made of acorn caps from the oldest oak in the woods.
A rough‑forged knife with an etched blade.
A snake skull in a wicker cage.
A battered stuffed animal missing one eye.

spell.name: Ancestral Communion
entries: You invoke the wisdom of your ancestors to gain insight into your trials. When you cast the spell, and at the start of each of your turns for the duration, you gain Heroic Inspiration if you don’t already have it.

spell.name: Blood Bolt
entries: You hurl a twisting bolt of blood at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 Necrotic damage, and you gain a number of T emporary Hit Points equal to your Proficiency Bonus. Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d6 when you reach levels 5 (2d6), 11 (3d6), and 17 (4d6).

spell.name: Blood Sacrifice

components.mMaterial: a drop of your own blood

entries: You sacrifice a portion of your life force to enhance your magical power. When you cast this spell, you take 1d6 Necrotic damage, which can't be reduced or prevented in any way. For the duration, when you cast a spell that deals damage, one target of the spell (your choice) takes an extra 1d6 damage of the same type as the spell’s normal damage type (your choice if there are multiple). Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage you take and the extra damage your spells deal both increase by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 2.BURIED ALIVE Level 4 Transmutation (Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard) Casting Time: Action Range: 60 feet Components: V, S, M (a pinch of grave dirt) Duration: Instantaneous You send your enemies to their graves even if they aren’t dead yet. A creature that you can see within range that is standing on the ground must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the ground opens and swallows the target, burying it up to 10 feet deep. While buried, the target has T otal Cover, has the Restrained and Blinded conditions, and can’t breathe. On a successful save, the target has the Prone condition, and its Speed is 0 until the end of its next turn. A buried creature can dig out of the grave by using its action to make a DC 15 Strength (Athletics) check. On a success, it digs 5 feet closer to the surface. If it succeeds by 5 or more, it reaches the surface. When the creature reaches the surface, it exits the ground with the Prone condition. The target automatically succeeds on its saving throw if it’s standing on any thickness of stone or metal, or at least 2 inches of wood.

components.mMaterial: a bit of animal fur or hide

spell.name: Captivate Undead
entries: You usurp the negative energy animating an Undead creature that you can see within range, attempting to take control of it. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, for the duration, the target has the Charmed condition (ignoring any Immunity to that condition), and it is Friendly toward you. On a successful save, the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes against you before the start of your next turn. If you or any of your allies damage the target or force it to make a saving throw, the spell ends. Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Consuming Pyre
entries: You cause a creature that you can see within range to burst into consuming, relentless flames. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d8 Fire damage and 2d8 Necrotic or Radiant damage (choose when you cast the spell), and the radiant flames linger. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only. While the flames linger, the creature takes the damage again at the start of each of its turns. The target, or another creature within reach of the target, can take an action to allow the target to repeat the saving throw, ending the spell on a success. A creature killed by the damage from this spell is reduced to ash, along with any nonmagical equipment it is wearing or carrying.

spell.name: Creeping Rot
entries: Warlock, Wizard) Casting Time: Action Range: 90 feet Components: V, S Duration: 1 minute You send tendrils of black and gray rot toward a target that you can see within range. Three tendrils then leap from that target to as many as three other targets of your choice, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or a nonmagical plant that isn’t a creature, such as a tree or shrub. In either case, each can be targeted by only one of the tendrils. A target that is a creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 3d8 Necrotic damage and has the Poisoned condition for the duration. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only. A creature Poisoned in this way takes 1d8 Necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. A Poisoned creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success. A Plant creature automatically fails the initial save, and a nonmagical plant that isn’t a creature simply withers and dies. Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. One additional tendril leaps from the first target to another target for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Crimson Harvest
entries: A wave of blood sweeps out from you in a 15-foot Emanation. Each creature of your choice in the wave must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d10 Necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If you damage at least one Small or larger creature, one creature of your choice that you can see within the Emanation regains a number of Hit Points equal to half the damage roll. Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 3.CROOKED WARD Level 3 Abjuration (Druid, Ranger, Warlock, Wizard) Casting Time: Action Range: Touch Components: V, S, M (a five-pointed wicker star) Duration: Concentration, up to 10 minutes You touch an immobile surface and mark a symbol that causes agony in twisted creatures. An Invisible, 30-foot- radius Sphere springs out from the point you touch. Each Aberration, Fey, Fiend, Monstrosity, or Undead in the Sphere has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls. When an affected creature enters the Sphere for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Frightened condition until the start of its next turn. Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can maintain Concentration on this spell for longer if you cast it using a spell slot of level 4 (up to 1 hour) or 5 (up to 8 hours). If you use a level 6+ spell slot, the spell doesn't require Concentration, and the duration becomes 24 hours.

spell.name: Culling Sickle
entries: You create a ghostly sickle that lasts for the duration and can strike out at your foes. The sickle appears hovering in your space and moves with you. When you cast this spell and as a Bonus Action on each of your turns, you can direct it to fly at and strike a creature within 30 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 Necrotic damage, and you gain T emporary Hit Points equal to half the damage dealt. After the sickle hits or misses, it returns to hover in your space. Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Cursed Cacophony
entries: You focus on a creature that you are familiar with that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be cursed for the duration. Once a target fails its saving throw against this spell, you can't target it with a ritual casting of the spell for 24 hours. While cursed, the target hears haunting, discordant music and has Disadvantage on D20 T ests. The first time the target fails a D20 T est during a turn, it repeats the save against this spell with neither Advantage nor Disadvantage, ending the spell early on a success.

spell.name: Devil's Due

time.condition: which you take when another creature within range takes damage

entries: creature within range takes damage Range: 30 feet Components: S, M (a glob of pitch) Duration: Instantaneous You absorb a measure of a creature's suffering and escaping vital essence. Expend and roll one Hit Point Die. You regain a number of Hit Points equal to the number rolled plus your spellcasting ability modifier. If the creature took damage from a Critical Hit, double the number of Hit Points you regain. Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can expend one additional Hit Point Die for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Dissolution
entries: You touch a creature or nonmagical object and break the target’s substance down into its most fundamental components. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 Force damage, and its AC is reduced by 1 against the next attack roll made against it before the end of your next turn. Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d8 when you reach levels 5 (2d8), 11 (3d8), and 17 (4d8).EYE BURN Transmutation Cantrip (Druid, Warlock, Wizard) Casting Time: Reaction, which you take when a creature you can see within range targets you with an attack Range: 30 feet Components: V, S, M (a smear of camphor) Duration: 1 round You sting the eyes of a creature attacking you. The target must make a Constitution saving throw (a creature with Blindsight or Immunity to the Blinded condition succeeds automatically). On a failed save, the target has the Blinded condition until the end of the turn. On a successful save, it must subtract 1d4 from the triggering attack roll. The target automatically succeeds on its saves against your subsequent casting of this spell for 24 hours.

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within range targets you with an attack

components.mMaterial: a dried corn husk or wheat hull

spell.name: Ghastly Charge
entries: You call forth the spirits of long-dead knights, which charge forward from you in a 90-foot long, 20-foot wide Line, and then vanish. Each creature of your choice in the Line must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 5d12 Necrotic damage, has the Frightened condition until the start of your next turn, and must immediately use its Reaction, if available, to move as far from you as it can, using the safest route. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d12 for each spell slot level above 6.

spell.name: Harvest Moonglow
entries: You call upon the light of the harvest moon to illuminate a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range. The area is bathed in silvery Dim Light. Creatures and objects with the Invisible condition in the light become visible as translucent, shimmering images. When one of your allies is within the light, it can use a Bonus Action to absorb some of the light and gain 2d6 T emporary Hit Points. Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The T emporary Hit Points increase by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.HARROWING BALLAD Level 2 Enchantment (Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard) Casting Time: Bonus Action Range: 120 feet Components: V, S Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute You inflict a mind-eroding song on a creature that you can see within range. If the creature has an Intelligence of 4 or higher, it must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or have the Charmed condition for the duration. While Charmed in this way, the target is struck with a rapidly repeating ballad that only it can hear; it takes 1d6 Psychic damage at the start of each of its turns, and it has Disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on Constitution saving throws made to maintain its Concentration. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success. Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Hungering Blade
entries: You imbue a weapon you are holding, or your Unarmed Strikes, with ravenous negative energy. For the duration, when you hit a creature with an attack using the empowered weapon or Unarmed Strike for the first time on a turn, the target takes Necrotic damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier, and you gain a number of T emporary Hit Points equal to the Necrotic damage dealt.

spell.name: Intrusive Despair
entries: You curse a creature within range, filling its mind with creeping paranoia and despair. When the target takes the Attack or Magic action, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or waste its action. Once the target succeeds on three saving throws against this spell, the spell ends.

spell.name: Isolation
entries: One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have its mind shrouded in the dread of total isolation. For the duration, all other creatures have the Invisible condition toward the target, which the target can’t see through—even with Blindsight, Truesight, or magic such as the See Invisibility spell—and the target can’t perceive other creatures with any of its other senses. The target moves around other creatures, or otherwise rationalizes not moving through spaces occupied by them (such as perceiving a door as closed or as a wall if another creature is standing in the way). The target still feels pain but can’t identify the source of any injury caused by another creature. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.

spell.name: Lucky Charm

components.mMaterial: a four-leaf clover and a shard of broken mirror

entries: broken mirror) Duration: Concentration, up to 1 hour You touch a Tiny, nonmagical object, infusing it with a portion of your own luck for the duration. While another creature carries the object, that creature has Advantage on D20 T ests, and you have Disadvantage on D20 T ests.MARTYR Level 3 Necromancy (Cleric, Paladin, Wizard) Casting Time: Action Range: Touch Components: V, S, M (a Dagger worth at least 1 CP) Duration: Instantaneous You touch a dead creature that died within the last minute and transfer your life essence into it. The target returns to life with Hit Points equal to your current Hit Point total. You immediately drop to 0 Hit Points (which nothing can prevent) with two failed Death Saving Throws, and you must immediately make a Death Save. You can’t regain Hit Points or become Stable until after you make this save.

components.mMaterial: a Dagger worth at least 1 CP

spell.name: Mirrored Agony

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 60 feet of you damages your ally

spell.name: Mysterious Presence
entries: You touch a willing creature and shroud its presence. Until the spell ends, other creatures must subtract 1d4 from any Wisdom (Insight or Perception) checks made against the target.PUPPET MASTER Level 4 Enchantment (Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard) Casting Time: Action Range: 60 feet Components: V, S, M (a marionette string) Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Charmed condition for the duration. Magical marionette strings attach to the Charmed creature’s limbs or body, and it must use its action on its turn to make a melee attack against a creature other than itself that you mentally choose, moving to reach the target if necessary. The target can act normally on its turn if you don’t choose another creature, or if the creature isn’t within the target’s reach after it moves. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success. On your later turns, you must take a Bonus Action to maintain control of the target, or the spell ends.

spell.name: Sacrificial Siphon
entries: You touch another creature and lay a curse that drains the target’s vitality and transfers it to you. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target is cursed for the duration. While cursed, the target must subtract 1d4 from its attack rolls and ability checks, and when the target takes damage, you can take a Reaction to gain 10 T emporary Hit Points. On a successful save, you gain 5 T emporary Hit Points, and the target must subtract 1d4 from its ability checks until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Scarlet Dawn
entries: Warlock, Wizard) Casting Time: Action Range: 120 feet Components: V, S Duration: Instantaneous Crimson light shines down in a 20-foot-radius, 60-foot- high Cylinder centered on a point within range. Each creature in that area that isn’t a Construct or Undead must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 4d10 Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Constructs and Undead in the area regain 4d10 Hit Points. If any of this spell’s area overlaps with an area of Darkness created by a spell of level 3 or lower, that other spell is dispelled. Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 and the level of spell that can be dispelled increases by 1 for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Shadow Drain
entries: You siphon away the vitality and sense of self through the shadows of nearby creatures in a 15-foot Emanation originating from you. When you cast this spell, you can designate creatures to be unaffected by it. Whenever any other creature enters the Emanation or starts its turn there, or when the Emanation enters a creature’s space, the creature must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d6 Necrotic damage and has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. A creature makes this save only once per turn. Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.SUMMER WINDS Level 2 Evocation (Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger) Casting Time: Action Range: Self Components: V, S Duration: Instantaneous You unleash a blast of light and wind in a 15-foot Cone. Your allies in the Cone regain 2d6 Hit Points. Undead within the Cone that are Hostile to you must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d6 Radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage and healing increase by 2d6 for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Unraveling Whisper
entries: Choose a creature you can see within range and whisper a frightful phrase that only the target can hear. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d6 Psychic damage and has the Frightened condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only. While Frightened in this way, the creature has Vulnerability to your choice of Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage. Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

components.mMaterial: a dried corn husk or wheat straw
